page.title: 12Farming around Crediton
page.content: There are{many types}of farming around Crediton. Here are a few of them: poultry, pigs, sheep, cow, deer and arable. {Arable}(swedes, turnips, corn etc.) farms are not very common in Devon because the ground contains a very high percentage of clay. {Livestock}(cows, sheep, pigs etc.) farming is more popular because the grass in Devon is good; it also brings in more money. People keep cows for showing, beef, milk and other dairy products. Sheep are also very popular because of their wool and meat and for showing at local shows{e.g.Devon {County Show.}Pigs are also kept for showing and meat. {Chickens,}turkeys, geese and ducks are kept either{free range}or in {battery farms.}They are kept for their meat, eggs and feathers.
